title: Blitz has the potential to be a great solo laner/jungler.
body:
Why not make him more of a skillful generalist and less of a 1HKO?

Introduce E as a double cast ability, first cast electrocharges blitz so that his autos become AoE (+AP) for ~5 seconds. Second cast ends the first cast to perform an auto attack reset as on live.

Slightly increase CD on his ult to compensate, reduce Rocket Grab's hitbox so that he can actually be impressive; hooking through minions instead of relying on a giant hitbox. It's not {{champion:25}} Q's hitbox, but it's pretty darn close. 

And there he can waveclear as a solo laner and a jungler without taking from his support ability. AD {{champion:53}} players happy, free waveclear so you can build {{item:3153}} instead of {{item:3074}}. AP {{champion:53}} happy, you can actually waveclear without using your ult.

replies.body: Or they could just revert the w nerf and balance his power around his grab instead of changing one of the things that makes him a good solo laner

Yeah I and a friend were very upset about the change as it nerfed his roaming across the board, every {{champion:53}} playstyle was hurt from the change and the champion himself felt more clunky to play like {{champion:84}} 's E change. I don't approve of the W change, I don't think {{champion:53}} slowing down is a meaningful weakness as he is often the tank; asking for aggro. I don't thinking making champions feel bad to play is a good method of nerfing a champion either.
That's why they removed the slow so long ago, reintroducing it is just a showcase of how riot doesn't actually understand the issues with their champions.

On the contrary, they do understand. His old W was a huge failsafe net covering every possible action Blitz could do. 
Miss a hook? Beep-boop and knock them up anyway. 
Don't think you can hit a hook? Just beep-boop towards them. If they run in zigzag you'll catch up, power fist them nd then hook when they try to escape. They run in a straight line? Easy hook.
Mess up an engage or get caught? Laugh and beep-boop to safety with your huge shield and reliable speed boost.

The hook is the issue with Blitz. It is the single most powerful basic ability in the game, and arguably more powerful than lots of ultimates. Someone with an access to that kind of tool should NOT have a reliable, long, no-drawbacks mobility tool.

Too bad solo lane Blitz had to suffer, but he's not the only one. Zyra, Morgana, Annie, Veigar - all took a hit to their primary role when they became too strong in botlane. Anyway, I'm happy with every nerf to that toxic piece of shit is made more manageable in bot lane.

Not sure why i never see people in DotA complaining about pudge hooks when they're far superior to blitz's short ranged grab, but man the LoL community really hates that whole positioning thing. The fix that blitz needed was to make his hook's hit box more precise, so it could go between minions if you're skilled enough, but doesn't grab a person that the animation had no contact with. People consistently counterpick top and mid laners, but why don't people ever think of grabbing someone who punishes the team for grabbing them.... I play Ali bot all the time, and blitz's are so afraid to help me initiate they rarely ever throw out their hooks. If this rage is coming from blind pick matches, the issue is not accounting for every possibility in pick phase.

Well, DotA is kinda 'everything is OP so it's balanced in the end'. Hook (that can also catch allies) doesn't sound so bad in a game with 1200 damage no cooldown nuke, 15+ second silence, 4 second and max movespeed stealth on cooldown of 6 seconds, passive dodge effects that also work on spells, a stun which also taunts your allies into attack you, 3+ second stuns on basic abilities, 4 second cooldown blinks, 9 second unbreakable spell shield, and much more.

I'll agree partly, but DotA players can't deal with skill shots to save their lives, since there are so few. Blitz's hook's wonky ass hitbox makes it really difficult to snatch a person mid creep wave, but people still think that's not a valid counter. The way support blitz's itemize, they get barely any gains from their passive, so the whole too tanky to kill thing is plain bullshit. I can see him being tough to deal with when you have no frontline, but this meta is all about tanks, people blitz's shit their pants from grabbing. The player base complains so much about champs with straight forward counters like Nasus tryndamere and blitz that I find it hard to even take them seriously, especially when champs like Leblanc exist.

Yes, it might be straight-forward to counter. But the real problem is how much power that single ability holds - juking/outplaying/baiting it out 19 times doesn't mean shit when it luckily connects 20th time and nets Blitz's team an instant win in a teamfight... or an instant loss if he pulls a tank. No other ability holds that much power.

And be honest: wouldn't you like to see his Q get hit so he can get some free space in his power budget? Reduce the hitbox and range, make it like Varus' Q so that it slows you and increases in range while you charge up.
There, now we can revert the slow on W that Blitz players complain about so much. We can make his E more interesting. We can make him both better to play as and against.

As an avid AD {{champion:53}} player, the one thing that seemed to be overlooked about the W changes by Riot is that Blitz's attack speed steroid lost 3 seconds. That's huge! I tried jungling {{champion:53}} , and needless to say it is abysmal.

In terms of the top lane, I find myself no longer able to force extended skirmishes. However, this isn't necessarily a bad thing because Blitz is insanely fast for the first second of his W. This allows him to close the gap between him and the enemy laner very quickly, and in my experience it often catches the opponent by surprise. This allows me to land E plus a few auto attacks and then retreat before the slow kicks in if I am not going to all-in the enemy laner.
Blitz is currently enjoying his place on my permaban list. The W change was pretty pointless and did not address his toxic play style. Getting pretty tired of this cross-screen grab-fest.

Blitz was a strong solo top against lower sustain top laners right up until his nerf. losing the attack speed duration in addition to speed nerf makes his ability to fight top much harder. 

Riot also refused to update his attack point, since it makes the dreaded Q->E more effective, this also hurts him in lane. 

Unfortunately all riot has done with the changes has taken blitz out of vogue at high level play, and instead brought thresh back into every game. Who saves more characters with latern then blitz *ever* could with hooks at high level. 

People love putting the "One hook could win the game!" nonsense out there. One thresh hook can win the game, one lantern pull on an all in on the ADC can win the game. One sej ult can win the game. its a parroted phrase which people will spit out because they heard someone say it once before, without really thinking of what is trying to be said. 

Hell, one hook can lose the game too, if you try to hook that ADC and the enemy top or jungler has flash up, they can just as easily flash into your line of fire and end the game with a free initiation that is a disaster for your team.

Doesn't sound like a very free initiation if he had to blow flash to get it.. 

That said, Fuck Blitz. Anyway, I wish his solo laning didn't have to be hit as a result of his support prowess, but he is not the first to suffer from that, nor will he be the last. I won't even pretend that's the case. Riot kinda knew what they were doing by nerfing support Blitz in the way that they did, it just hit top Blitz as well.

Anyway, tell Annie, Veigar, Zyra and Morgana we all said 'Hi' in botlane while Riot nerfs their main role because of their strengths in the support role. I'm sure Blitz will understand.

So you're saying since Riot fucked up (not from their standpoint) so many other champions that Blitz deserves it? Unless you play as many immobile heroes as I do, I can't find any reason to hate him so much.

What makes him so special that he should get to avoid the same treatment others received? Part of his strength in his other roles (top, the occasional jungle) also skirted by using the exact same strengths support Blitz does, so if support Blitz is horrendous to play against then nerfing a strength from that specific playstyle will very likely be nerfing that same strength in all of the other roles. Blitzcrank is very straightforward, and his skills don't have a ton of nuance to them (shield based on mana at low hp, hook, M.Speed/Atk.Speed increase, knock-up on next hit, AoE silencing ult w/ damage). So he can potentially be versatile, but it's off the exact same strengths the others use.

Just add a passive to his Q that is only active when hook is not on CD

For example

-blitz regains 1% of his missing hp and mana when he kills a target, this effect is disabled while Q is on CD, this gives him sustain to help with solo laning and benefits solo lane more than jungle making him able to solo lane better without jump starting his jungle ability and will have much lower impact for support blitz (edit: because he isn't last hitting things)

I think some work could be done with blitz just in general. He feels clunky, which I guess is thematic in a way, but idk he's just goony now. Playing him support I rarely buy sightstone since it's too expensive most games, and just opt for an upgraded yellow trinket instead.

I actually spent a lot of time in bot games trying to perfect this. It's fine on the practice field, but for some reason I could never get it to translate to actual games. And of course you have to convince your teammates to allow you to jungle Blitz. I've had a lot of success with Leona and Alistar, although they are considerably slower than AD Blitz.

I am personally fine with him the way he is.  His hook power is strong.  If he catches someone, especially a damage dealer, his team basically won the game if its late game.  He can also do this no matter how fed he is, meaning he can basically feed all game, but pull off a godly hook then win the game.  What makes him bearable is that he isn't that good as a solo laner.  His only good waveclear is his ultimate, which he needs to use to kill someone with(if AP).  He doesn't really have the ability to fight against more competitive picks, which is fine because of how strong his hook is.
